meanings.definition: To establish the paternity of (a child).
meanings.sent1: The DNA test confirmed his role in filiating the child.
meanings.sent2: The court ordered a filiating test to determine the father of the baby.
meanings.sent3: It was a comical mix-up when the filiating results showed the wrong dad.
meanings.sent4: His presence in the family was like filiating the missing piece of a puzzle.
meanings.sent5: The act of filiating brought clarity and resolution to the family tree.

meanings.definition: To attribute or ascribe (something) to a particular origin or source.
meanings.sent1: The ancient manuscript filiating the legend to a distant civilization was discovered.
meanings.sent2: Historians often filiate the development of language to specific cultural influences.
meanings.sent3: It was amusing to see him filiating his success to a lucky charm.
meanings.sent4: Her creativity filiates back to her childhood experiences like a flowing river.
meanings.sent5: The artist's masterpiece filiated inspiration from nature's beauty.
